creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: two women in kimono with umbrellas walking through flooded street (or pond?) at L; in background is a small hill with large, blossoming tree with supports and lattice; silhouettes of trees in far back
inscription: left, cursive jizuri: 自摺　昭和拾年作　櫻八題　春雨 {jizuri, Shōwa jūnen saku, Sakura hachidai, Harusame} | bottom: Yozakura in Rain | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Eight Scenes of Cherry Blossom (Sakura hachidai 櫻八題)
title: Spring Rain
